intro: Tetrastigma sulcatum, commonly known as the rough-stemmed crossvine, is a climbing vine native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are berries that mature to a dark purple color, containing several seeds. Tetrastigma sulcatum is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in shaded, humid environments.
